  • Exports

An in-memory SQL database library. NimternalSQL uses the same interface as the Nim db_*.nim database wrappers.

Examples

Opening a connection to a database

import db_nimternalsql
let db = open("", "", "", "")
db.close()

Creating a table

db.exec(sql"DROP TABLE IF EXISTS my_table")
db.exec(sql"""CREATE TABLE my_table (
                 id integer PRIMARY KEY,
                 name varchar(50) not null)""")

Because tables are implemented using hash tables, specifying a primary key is required.

Inserting data

db.exec(sql"INSERT INTO my_table (id, name) VALUES (0, ?)",
        "Nicolas")

Imports

db_nimternalsql/nqcommon, db_nimternalsql/nqtables, db_nimternalsql/sqlscanner, db_nimternalsql/sqlparser, db_nimternalsql/join, db_nimternalsql/groupby, db_nimternalsql/duprem, db_nimternalsql/union, db_nimternalsql/nqexcept, db_nimternalsql/intersect, db_nimternalsql/sorter, db_nimternalsql/snapshot, db_nimternalsql/tx

Types

DbConn = ref object
  db: Database
  errorMsg: string
  tx: Tx
  autocommit: bool
  logFile: File
A NimternalSQL SQL database. 
Row = seq[string]
A row of a dataset. NULL database values will be converted to empty strings.

    tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Executes the query and raises DbError if not successful.

    ...raises: [KeyError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
Executes the prepared query and raises DbError if not successful.

    ...raises: [SqlError, ValueError, Exception, KeyError, Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Executes the query (typically "UPDATE") and returns the number of affected rows.

proc getRow(conn: DbConn; query: SqlQuery; args: varargs[string, `$`]): Row {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, ValueError, Exception, KeyError],
    tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
Retrieves a single row. If the query doesn't return any rows, this proc will return a Row with empty strings for each column. 
proc getRow(conn: DbConn; stmt: SqlPrepared; args: varargs[string, `$`]): Row {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, KeyError, ValueError], tags: [].}
proc getValue(conn: DbConn; query: SqlQuery; args: varargs[string, `$`]): string {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, ValueError, Exception, KeyError],
    tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
Executes the query and returns the first column of the first row of the result dataset. Returns "" if the dataset contains no rows or the database value is NULL. 
proc getValue(conn: DbConn; stmt: SqlPrepared; args: varargs[string, `$`]): string {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, KeyError, ValueError], tags: [].}
Executes the prepared query and returns the first column of the first row of the result dataset. Returns "" if the dataset contains no rows or the database value is NULL. 
func len(row: InstantRow): int {....raises: [SqlError], tags: [].}
Returns number of columns in a row. 
proc open(connection, user, password, database: string): DbConn {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, OSError, IOError, ValueError, EOFError, KeyError],
    tags: [ReadDirEffect, WriteDirEffect, ReadIOEffect].}

Opens a database, creating a new database in memory. The user, password, and database arguments are ignored. For compatibility with future versions, empty strings should be passed.

If the connection argument is not an empty string, it is the name of a directory where the transaction log file is kept. If open() finds a file "dump.ndb" this directory, it restores the database from this file. Afterwards, if open() finds a transaction log file, it reads the file to restore the last state of the database.

proc prepare(conn: DbConn; sql: SqlQuery): SqlPrepared {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, ValueError, Exception], tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
Creates a new SqlPrepared statement. Parameter substitution is done via $1, $2, $3, etc. 
proc restore(conn: DbConn; filename: string) {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, IOError, ValueError, EOFError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Restores a previously saved database snapshot from a file named filename. 
proc save(conn: DbConn) {....raises: [IOError, SqlError, ValueError, TimeParseError],
                          tags: [WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
If transaction logging is active, a snapshot file "dump.ndb" is saved in the directory that was passed to open() and the transaction log is truncated. Otherwise, a snapshot file "dump.ndb" is saved in the current directory. 
proc save(conn: DbConn; filename: string) {.
    ...raises: [IOError, SqlError, ValueError, TimeParseError],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
Saves a snapshot of the database to a file named filename. 
proc setAutocommit(db: DbConn; ac: bool) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Sets the auto-commit mode of the connection given by db to ac. 
proc sqlState(err: ref DbError): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Extracts an SQLSTATE value from a DbError instance. 
proc tryExec(db: DbConn; query: SqlQuery; args: varargs[string, `$`]): bool {.
    ...raises: [KeyError, ValueError, Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
Tries to execute the prepared query and returns true if successful, false otherwise. 
proc tryExec(db: DbConn; stmt: SqlPrepared; args: varargs[string, `$`]): bool {.
    ...raises: [KeyError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
Tries to execute the prepared query and returns true if successful, false otherwise.

    ...raises: [SqlError, KeyError], tags: [].}
Executes the prepared query and iterates over the result dataset. 
iterator instantRows(conn: DbConn; sql: SqlQuery; args: varargs[string, `$`]): InstantRow {.
    ...raises: [SqlError, ValueError, Exception, KeyError],
    tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
Executes the query and iterates over the result dataset. The InstantRows instance returned is not guaranteed to be valid outside the iterator body.
